midas/NT/directio/tstio.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*********************************************************************
00002 
00003 Author:     Dale Roberts, Stefan Ritt
00004 Date:       8/30/95, update 12/18/96 to use directIO driver
00005 Program:    TSTIO.C
00006 Compile:    cl -DWIN32 tstio.c
00007 
00008 Purpose:    Test the GIVEIO device driver by doing some direct
00009             port I/O.  We access the PC's internal speaker.
00010 
00011 *********************************************************************/
00012 
00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 #include <windows.h>
00015 #include <math.h>
00016 #include <conio.h>
00017 
00018 typedef struct {
00019         short int pitch;
00020         short int duration;
00021 } NOTE;
00022 
00023 /*
00024  *  Table of notes.  Given in half steps.  It's a communication from
00025  * the "other side."
00026  */
00027 NOTE notes[] = {{14, 500}, {16, 500}, {12, 500}, {0, 500}, {7, 1000}};
00028 
00029 /*********************************************************************
00030   Set PC's speaker frequency in Hz.  The speaker is controlled by an
00031 Intel 8253/8254 timer at I/O port addresses 0x40-0x43.
00032 *********************************************************************/
00033 void setfreq(int hz)
00034 {
00035         hz = 1193180 / hz;                                              // clocked at 1.19MHz
00036         _outp(0x43, 0xb6);                                              // timer 2, square wave
00037         _outp(0x42, hz);
00038         _outp(0x42, hz >> 8);
00039 }
00040 
00041 /*********************************************************************
00042   Pass a note, in half steps relative to 400 Hz.  The 12 step scale
00043 is an exponential thing.  The speaker control is at port 0x61.
00044 Setting the lowest two bits enables timer 2 of the 8253/8254 timer
00045 and turns on the speaker.
00046 *********************************************************************/
00047 void playnote(NOTE note)
00048 {
00049         _outp(0x61, _inp(0x61) | 0x03);                 // start speaker going
00050         setfreq((int)(400 * pow(2, note.pitch / 12.0)));
00051         Sleep(note.duration);
00052         _outp(0x61, _inp(0x61) & ~0x03);                // stop that racket!
00053 }
00054 
00055 
00056 /*********************************************************************
00057   Communication routines with directio device driver
00058 *********************************************************************/
00059 static HANDLE _hdio = 0;
00060 
00061 INT ss_directio_init()
00062 {
00063   _hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
00064                                        OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
00065   return (INT) _hdio;
00066 }
00067 
00068 INT ss_directio_exit()
00069 {
00070   return CloseHandle(_hdio);
00071 }
00072 
00073 INT ss_directio_give_port(INT start, INT end)
00074 {
00075 DWORD buffer[] = {6, start, end, 0};
00076 DWORD size;
00077 
00078   if (_hdio <= 0)
00079     return 0;
00080 
00081   if (DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), 
00082                       NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00083     return 1;
00084 
00085   return GetLastError();
00086 }
00087 
00088 INT ss_directio_lock_port(INT start, INT end)
00089 {
00090 DWORD buffer[] = {7, start, end, 0};
00091 DWORD size;
00092 
00093   if (_hdio <= 0)
00094     return 0;
00095 
00096   if (DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), 
00097                       NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00098     return 1;
00099 
00100   return GetLastError();
00101 }
00102 
00103 /*********************************************************************
00104   Main program. Request ports 0x42, 0x43 and 0x61 and play music
00105 *********************************************************************/
00106 
00107 int main()
00108 {
00109 int i;
00110 
00111   ss_directio_init();
00112   ss_directio_lock_port(0, 0xFFFF);
00113   ss_directio_give_port(0x42, 0x43);
00114   ss_directio_give_port(0x61, 0x61);
00115   ss_directio_exit();
00116 
00117         for(i=0; i < sizeof(notes)/sizeof(int); ++i)
00118                 playnote(notes[i]);
00119 
00120         return 0;
00121 }
